intro: Cypella trimontina, commonly known as the Three-lobed Cypella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
